intro: Jacquemontia floribunda, commonly known as the showy golden vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are slender and climbing. Jacquemontia floribunda thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks.
